result.execSummary:
The defendant Deqwon D Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Due to warrant, defendant transported to Dodge County.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay applicable surcharge.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during the period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety, to include random drug screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deqwon D Evans

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, straight time.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR. Due to warrant, defendant transported to Dodge County. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment. 
-Absolute Sobriety to include random drug screens
-Provide DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge
-Remain/complete High School
-Complete 20 hours of community service

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Deqwon D Evans in court with Francesco Balistreri appearing under the Student Practice Rules as supervised by attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached an agreement. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 2 Dismissed, But Read In.

Defendant Deqwon D Evans in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deqwon D Evans in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

As an additional condition of bail:
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No drugs without a valid prescription
No drug paraphernalia

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.

Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Court orders case adjourned for pre-trial conference in Branch 24.

Defendant Deqwon D Evans in court with Attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Deqwon D Evans in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney. 
Clerk:  jms
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Deqwon D Evans not in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 10/6/15 @ 1:30 pm
